messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
This description does not reflect the actual meaning of this
boolean member. It fails to describe the IsGooglePinnedProperty
aspect.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
Remove "version". "ssl3_fallback_enabled" is sufficient.

(The |version_fallback| member below was originally named
|ssl3_fallback|. I generalized it to |version_fallback| in
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10377022.)

messages.author: thaidn_google
messages.text:
On 2013/04/17 23:22:05, wtc wrote:
> 
> This description does not reflect the actual meaning of this
> boolean member. It fails to describe the IsGooglePinnedProperty
> aspect.

Done.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text: It may be clearer to retain the original switch statement.

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
BUG?: I think this should be
    if (version_max > SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3 ||

messages.author: thaidn_google
messages.text:
On 2013/04/17 23:22:05, wtc wrote:
> 
> It may be clearer to retain the original switch statement.

Done.

messages.author: thaidn_google
messages.text:
No, it isn't a bug (otherwise tests have failed).

The statements inside the if clause will cause the fallback. So we need to test two things:

* The protocol that we are going to use for the fallback would be SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3; and

* Either fallback is enabled or this is not a Google site.

On 2013/04/17 23:22:05, wtc wrote:
> 
> BUG?: I think this should be
>     if (version_max > SSL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_SSL3 ||

messages.author: wtc
messages.text:
On 2013/04/18 00:05:50, thaidn_google wrote:
> No, it isn't a bug (otherwise tests have failed).

The unit test HTTPSRequestTest.TLSv1Fallback in
net/url_request/url_request_unittest.cc should have caught
this. Do you know why that test didn't fail? Perhaps you
didn't run all the tests in net_unittests?

messages.author: wtc
messages.text: Nit: this is the last bullet item, so it can end with a period.
